abstract_summ: We develop a genetic algorithm technique to identify key model parameters employing COVID19 data from South Korea.Several features are observed in the data, namely a high predictability of the expansion of disease in Italy and a convergence of the “pushback” parameter towards a limiting value in all the countries where restrictive measures have been adopted.We analyze the early data on COVID-19 expansion in selected European countries using an analytical parametric model.We analyze the early data on COVID-19 expansion in selected European countries using an analytical parametric model.Basic predictions for the evolution of the disease expansion are made for selected countries with a stable evolution in the parametric space of the model.
title_summ: A Novel Method for the Estimation of a Dynamic Effective Reproduction Number (Dynamic-R) in the CoViD-19 OutbreakAdjoint-based Data Assimilation of an Epidemiology Model for the Covid-19 Pandemic in 2020A Computational Model for Estimating the Evolution of COVID-19 in Rondenia-BrazilParametric analysis of early data on COVID-19 expansion in selected European countriesNonlinear dynamic analysis of an epidemiological model for COVID-19 including public behavior and government actionParametric analysis of early data on COVID-19 expansion in selected European countries
title_abstract_phrases: Parametric analysis of early data on COVID-19 expansion in selected European countriesWe analyze the early data on COVID-19 expansion in selected European countries using an analytical parametric model.Parametric analysis of early data on COVID-19 expansion in selected European countriesWe analyze the early data on COVID-19 expansion in selected European countries using an analytical parametric model.We develop a genetic algorithm technique to identify key model parameters employing COVID19 data from South Korea.Several features are observed in the data, namely a high predictability of the expansion of disease in Italy and a convergence of the “pushback” parameter towards a limiting value in all the countries where restrictive measures have been adopted.The findings presented here should contribute to the understanding of the behavior of the disease expansion and the role of the restrictive measures on the evolution of the expansion.
